intro: Anemone kansuensis, commonly known as the Kansu anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has palmately divided leaves that are hairy and covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and protected areas.
